vocabulary.definition: the feeding stage of a parasite, characterized by active feeding and multiplication
vocabulary.example: The parasite was identified in its trophyozoite stage, actively hunting and thriving in the host's body.

vocabulary.definition: a type of microscopic organism consisting of a single cell with no definite shape
vocabulary.example: The pond water was teeming with various types of amoebae, each with its own unique characteristics.

vocabulary.definition: a type of white blood cell that helps the body fight infections by ingesting pathogens
vocabulary.example: The doctor observed an increase in neutrophil count in the patient's blood, indicating an active infection.

vocabulary.definition: a neurotransmitter responsible for various functions in the body, including muscle contraction and memory
vocabulary.example: The release of acetylcholine in the brain plays a crucial role in transmitting signals between nerve cells.

vocabulary.definition: a localized physical condition in which part of the body becomes reddened, swollen, hot, and often painful, especially as a reaction to injury or infection
vocabulary.example: The doctor prescribed anti-inflammatory medication to reduce the swelling and pain caused by the inflammation.

vocabulary.definition: a group of proteins in the blood that work together to defend against infections
vocabulary.example: The complement system plays a vital role in enhancing the body's immune response against invading pathogens.
